greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The number of 5th powers in the multiplicative group modulo n.
comment: The size of the set of numbers j^5 mod n, gcd(j,n)=1, 1 <= j <= n.
A000010(n) / a(n) is another multiplicative integer sequence.
link: R. J. Mathar, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..7548
R. J. Mathar, Size of the set of residues of integer powers of fixed exponent, (2017).
formula: a(n) = A000010(n)/A319099(n). This implies that the conjecture above is true. - _Jianing Song_, Nov 10 2019
maple: for j from 1 to n do
xref: The number of k-th powers in the multiplicative group modulo n: A046073 (k=2), A087692 (k=3), A250207 (k=4), this sequence (k=5), A293483 (k=6), A293484 (k=7), A293485 (k=8).
results.author: _R. J. Mathar_, Oct 10 2017
